Let's Talk

SciPlay

(Mobile Application)
Software
Language

About

This mobile App was developed from 2023 to 2024. It is designed for teacher users to create and add accounts for elementary student users so they can play and have their scores recorded.

Record Video

Intro Mobile App
(Splash Screen)

This is the splash screen of the mobile application created by the developers. The splash screen is the initial interface displayed to users upon launching the app, providing a visually engaging introduction and setting the tone for the overall user experience.

Intro

Logo Screen
(1st Intro)

Similar to the splash screen, the logo screen is presented to users upon launching the app, prominently displaying the application's branding and enhancing the initial user engagement.

Start Game
(2nd Intro)

This "Enter" button serves as the gateway to access the application's main features. Upon clicking this button, users will be directed to a screen presenting two additional buttons, providing options application. for further interaction within the application.

Loading Screen
(3rd Intro)

This loading screen appears after clicking the "Enter" button, as the application performs a connectivity check to determine internet availability. Its purpose is to provide users with a visual indication that the application is processing their request and verifying connectivity before proceeding further.

No Connection
(3rd Intro)

When there is no internet connection, the loading screen will display a notification indicating "No Connection." Users will be presented with a "Try Again" button, allowing them to return to the "Start Game" screen and prompting them to establish an internet connection before accessing the Sciplay mobile application. This process ensures a seamless user experience by encouraging users to ensure internet connectivity prior to launching the application.

Login user
(4th Intro)

When internet access is available, the loading screen transitions to the "Login User" screen. This screen presents two image buttons: one representing a "Teacher User" and the other a "Student User." Users can select the appropriate option based on their role within the Sciplay mobile application.

Demo (User Manual)

Student User
Login Form

In the "Student Login" form, users are provided with a "Back" button at the top of the interface for navigation back to the "Login User" screen. The form features two text boxes—one for entering the username (student's name) and the other for entering the password (student's name as well). Users with existing accounts can input their username and password and proceed by clicking the "Login" or "Submit" button. However, if a user doesn't have an account, they are prompted to reach out to their teacher for assistance in creating one.

About Us

Upon successful login, users are directed to the "About Us" or "Let's Play" section. This section provides users with an overview of the system or mobile application through a video presentation. The video showcases the features, functionalities, and content available within the application, offering users a comprehensive understanding of what the system has to offer.

Game Collection

The "Game Collection" serves as a repository for various games within the application. Each game is represented by an image button. Upon clicking on a game image button, users are directed to a screen detailing the specific game, including its title and associated image.

Play Game

In the "Play Games" section, users can explore various games available within the application. Upon clicking the "Start Play" button for a specific game, users initiate gameplay. The interface displays the title of the selected game. Additionally, users' names and images are visible within the interface. Clicking on a user's image reveals their name. To navigate back to the "Game Collection," users can click the "Back" button, which is labeled accordingly.

Profile

In the "Edit Profile" section, users can update their profile information, including the student‘s name, student number, email, and password. After making changes in the respective text boxes, users can save the updated information by clicking the "Save" button. However, it's important to note that upon saving changes, the application automatically logs out the user. This logout occurs because the interface does not refresh automatically, necessitating a manual login to reflect the updated profile information.

Teacher User
Login Form

The "Teacher Login" form features a "Back" button at the top for navigation back to the "Login User" screen. Below, two text boxes are provided for entering email and password details. Users with existing accounts can input their credentials and proceed by clicking the "Login" or "Submit" button. Alternatively, for new users, selecting the "New User? Create Account" text prompts the registration process for account creation.

Register Form

Users can create a new account by filling in the required fields and clicking "Submit" or "Sign Up." If they already have an account, they can click "Already Registered? Login" to go directly to the login form. The "Clear" button can be used to fix input errors before submitting.

Add Student Account From

After logging in, teachers access the "Add Student Account" section to link students to their sections. If no section exists, they can create one using the "Add" button. The teacher’s name is auto-filled. Teachers select a section from a dropdown and enter the student's name; the student’s password is the same as their username.

Add Section Form

In the "Add Section" interface, teachers enter a section name and click "Save" to add it to the dropdown list. The teacher’s name is auto-filled. If they choose not to proceed, clicking "Cancel" returns them to the "Add Student" section.

Game Collection

The "Game Collection" serves as a repository for various games within the application. Each game is represented by an image button. Upon clicking on a game image button, users are directed to a screen detailing the specific game, including its title and associated image.

Play Games

In the "Play Games" section, users can view the title of the selected game and initiate gameplay by clicking the "Start Play" button. Upon starting the game, users will encounter an interface displaying the current user's name and image. Clicking on the user's image reveals their name. To navigate back to the "Game Collection," users can click the "Back" button, which is labeled accordingly.

Profile (Image and General)

In the "Edit Profile" section, users can upload a profile image and access four options: "General," "School," "User Account," and "Logout." In "General," users can update personal details like name, birthdate, and gender. After saving changes, the system automatically logs the user out, requiring a manual login to view the updates.

Profile (School)

In the "School" section of the "Edit Profile" interface, users can update their teacher number, phone number, and school address. The fields are pre-filled with existing data. After saving changes, the system logs the user out automatically, requiring a manual login to see the updates.

Profile (User Account)

In the "User Account" section of the "Edit Profile" interface, users can update their email and password. The text boxes display the current email associated with the logged-in user, while the password field is masked for security purposes. After making changes, users can save the updated information by clicking the "Save" button.
